data.text: Then shall the righteous man stand in great boldness
When they see it, they shall be troubled with terrible fear,
And they repenting and groaning for anguish of spirit
We fools accounted his life madness,
How is he numbered among the children of God,
Therefore have we erred from the way of truth,
We wearied ourselves in the way of wickedness and destruction:
What hath pride profited us?
All those things are passed away like a shadow,
And as a ship that passeth over the waves of the water,
Or as when a bird hath flown through the air,
Or like as when an arrow is shot at a mark,
Even so we in like manner, as soon as we were born, began to draw to our end,
For the hope of the ungodly is like dust that is blown away with the wind;
But the righteous live for evermore;
Therefore shall they receive a glorious kingdom,
He shall take to him his jealousy for complete armor,
He shall put on righteousness as a breastplate,
He shall take holiness for an invincible shield.
His severe wrath shall he sharpen for a sword,
Then shall the right aiming thunderbolts go abroad;
And hailstones full of wrath shall be cast as out of a stone bow,
Yea, a mighty wind shall stand up against them,
